level.heading: Building permit denial.
level.text: An applicant may be denied a building permit by the Mayor for a period of:
Ten years from the date of final order on a criminal conviction against the applicant for a Construction Code or zoning regulations crime;
Three years after receipt of 5 or more stop work orders by the applicant in any 12-month period;
Three years after final administrative adjudication against the applicant for violation of the Construction Code or zoning regulations; or
Three years from the date of revocation of a building permit or certificate of occupancy issued to the applicant.
